keyTakeAways: Benjamin Netanyahu has dismissed Tzachi Hanegbi, his national security adviser, and appointed Gil Reich as acting head of the National Security Council.

Hanegbi's departure is linked to longstanding disagreements with Netanyahu over the military strategy in Gaza, particularly Hanegbi's opposition to a full military takeover of Gaza City and support for a partial deal with Hamas.
Hanegbi publicly admitted shared responsibility for the failures that led to the Hamas-led attack on October 7, 2023, and called for a thorough investigation into the incident.

Israel’s government has not yet established a formal commission to investigate the October 7 attack, prompting criticism from opposition figures like Gadi Eisenkot, who accused Netanyahu’s administration of evading responsibility.
Gil Reich, a deputy head of the National Security Council, is now serving as acting head, signaling a shift in leadership and possibly a move toward more aligned strategic priorities under Netanyahu.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has dismissed Tzachi Hanegbi, his national security adviser, citing growing internal disagreements over military strategy in Gaza, particularly Hanegbi’s opposition to a full military takeover and support for a partial ceasefire with Hamas. Hanegbi, who served since 2023, publicly admitted shared responsibility for the failures leading to the October 7, 2023 Hamas attack and called for a thorough investigation, which the government has not yet established. In response, Netanyahu has appointed Gil Reich, the deputy head of the National Security Council, as acting head, signaling a shift in leadership and strategy. The move has drawn criticism from opposition figures like Gadi Eisenkot, who argue that the dismissal reflects political evasion of accountability rather than effective governance.
title: Israel’s Netanyahu fires national security chief amid Gaza tensions
